title: Examples
code: # See ?Quantile or ?onesample.quantile t <- pmt(     "onesample.quantile", alternative = "greater",     prob = 0.5, null_value = 75,     type = "asymp", correct = FALSE )  # See ?Table1.1.1 t$test(Table1.1.1)  t$statistic #> [1] 26 t$p_value #> [1] 0.02888979 t$conf_int #> [1] 75.0 77.1

title: Examples
code: # See ?CDF or ?onesample.cdf t <- pmt("onesample.cdf")  # See ?Table1.2.1 t$test(Table1.2.1)  t$plot(style = "ggplot2")

title: Examples
code: # See ?Quantile or ?onesample.quantile t <- pmt(     "onesample.quantile",     prob = 0.25, null_value = 0, conf_level = 0.90 )  # See ?Table1.2.1 t$test(Table1.2.1)  t$conf_int #> [1] 11 29

title: Examples
code: # See ?Difference or ?twosample.difference t <- pmt(     "twosample.difference",     alternative = "greater", method = "mean", n_permu = 0 )  # See ?Table2.1.1 t$test(Table2.1.1)  t$statistic #> [1] 16.16667 t$p_value #> [1] 0.05714286

title: Examples
code: # See ?Wilcoxon or ?twosample.wilcoxon t <- pmt(     "twosample.wilcoxon", alternative = "greater", n_permu = 0 )  # See ?Table2.1.1 t$test(Table2.1.1)  t$statistic #> [1] 21 t$p_value #> [1] 0.05714286

title: Examples
code: # See ?Difference or ?twosample.difference t <- pmt(     "twosample.difference",     alternative = "greater", method = "mean", n_permu = 0 )  # See ?Table2.3.1 t$test(Table2.3.1)  t$statistic #> [1] 1.675  # all permutaions t$p_value #> [1] 0.1966589  # 1000 permutaions t$n_permu <- 1000 t$p_value #> [1] 0.188

title: Examples
code: # See ?Wilcoxon or ?twosample.wilcoxon t <- pmt(     "twosample.wilcoxon", alternative = "greater", n_permu = 0 )  # See ?Table2.6.1 t$test(Table2.6.1)  t$statistic #> [1] 14 t$p_value #> [1] 0.9

title: Examples
code: # See ?Wilcoxon or ?twosample.wilcoxon t <- pmt(     "twosample.wilcoxon", conf_level = 0.90 )  # See ?Table2.6.2 t$test(Table2.6.2)  t$estimate #> [1] 30.045 t$conf_int #> [1] 13.84 47.96

title: Examples
code: # See ?ScoreSum or ?twosample.scoresum t <- pmt(     "twosample.scoresum",     alternative = "greater", scoring = "expon", n_permu = 0 )  # See ?Table2.6.2 t$test(Table2.6.2)  t$statistic #> [1] 9.752597 t$p_value #> [1] 0.002164502

title: Examples
code: # See ?SiegelTukey or ?twosample.siegel t <- pmt(     "twosample.siegel", alternative = "greater", type = "asymp" )  # See ?Table2.8.1 t$test(Table2.8.1)  t$statistic #> [1] 27 t$p_value #> [1] 0.5

title: Examples
code: # See ?RatioDifferenceDeviance or ?twosample.rmd t <- pmt(     "twosample.rmd", alternative = "greater", n_permu = 0 )  # See ?Table2.8.1 t$test(Table2.8.1)  t$statistic #> [1] 4.666667 t$p_value #> [1] 0.06349206

title: Examples
code: # See ?KolmogorovSmirnov or ?twosample.ks t <- pmt(     "twosample.ks", n_permu = 0 )  # See ?Table2.8.1 t$test(Table2.8.1)  t$statistic #> [1] 0.4 t$p_value #> [1] 0.8730159

title: Examples
code: # See ?OneWay or ?ksample.oneway t <- pmt(     "ksample.oneway", type = "asymp" )  # See ?Table3.1.2 t$test(Table3.1.2)  t$statistic #> [1] 3.781445 t$p_value #> [1] 0.05327082  t$n_permu <- 0 t$type <- "permu"  t$statistic #> [1] 11552.89 t$p_value #> [1] 0.05127412

title: Examples
code: # See ?KruskalWallis or ?ksample.kw t <- pmt(     "ksample.kw", type = "asymp" )  # See ?Table3.2.2 t$test(Table3.2.2)  t$statistic #> [1] 17.14286 t$p_value #> [1] 0.0006605027

title: Examples
code: # See ?KruskalWallis or ?ksample.kw t <- pmt(     "ksample.kw", n_permu = 4000 )  # See ?Table3.2.3 t$test(Table3.2.3)  t$statistic #> [1] 8.246588 t$p_value #> [1] 0.01425  t$type <- "asymp" t$p_value #> [1] 0.01619109

title: Examples
code: # See ?Studentized or ?multcomp.studentized t <- pmt(     "multcomp.studentized", n_permu = 5000, method = "bonferroni" )  # See ?Table3.3.1 t$test(Table3.3.1)  t$print() #>  #>   Multiple Comparison Based on Studentized Statistic  #>  #> scoring: none    type: permu(5000)    method: bonferroni #>  #> family-wise confidence level: 95% #>  #>                           statistic p-value   #> location_1 ~ location_2  0.02737145  0.9740   #> location_1 ~ location_3 -1.77914406  0.0852   #> location_1 ~ location_4 -3.41048230  0.0036 * #> location_2 ~ location_3 -1.80651550  0.0860   #> location_2 ~ location_4 -3.43785375  0.0048 * #> location_3 ~ location_4 -1.63133824  0.1148  t$type <- "asymp" t$print() #>  #>   Multiple Comparison Based on Studentized Statistic  #>  #> scoring: none    type: asymp    method: bonferroni #>  #> family-wise confidence level: 95% #>  #>                           statistic     p-value   #> location_1 ~ location_2  0.02737145 0.978434752   #> location_1 ~ location_3 -1.77914406 0.090419680   #> location_1 ~ location_4 -3.41048230 0.002773484 * #> location_2 ~ location_3 -1.80651550 0.085909110   #> location_2 ~ location_4 -3.43785375 0.002603664 * #> location_3 ~ location_4 -1.63133824 0.118466249  t$scoring <- "rank" t$print() #>  #>   Multiple Comparison Based on Studentized Statistic  #>  #> scoring: rank    type: asymp    method: bonferroni #>  #> family-wise confidence level: 95% #>  #>                          statistic     p-value   #> location_1 ~ location_2  0.1224745 0.902523250   #> location_1 ~ location_3 -1.3880442 0.165123590   #> location_1 ~ location_4 -2.6536139 0.007963489 * #> location_2 ~ location_3 -1.5105187 0.130911128   #> location_2 ~ location_4 -2.7760884 0.005501725 * #> location_3 ~ location_4 -1.2655697 0.205667180   t$method <- "tukey" t$print() #>  #>   Multiple Comparison Based on Studentized Statistic  #>  #> scoring: rank    type: asymp    method: tukey #>  #> family-wise confidence level: 95% #>  #>                         statistic    p-value   #> location_1 ~ location_2 0.1732051 0.99934385   #> location_1 ~ location_3 1.9629909 0.50683497   #> location_1 ~ location_4 3.7527767 0.03978340 * #> location_2 ~ location_3 2.1361960 0.43109997   #> location_2 ~ location_4 3.9259818 0.02817015 * #> location_3 ~ location_4 1.7897858 0.58494735  t$scoring <- "none" t$print() #>  #>   Multiple Comparison Based on Studentized Statistic  #>  #> scoring: none    type: asymp    method: tukey #>  #> family-wise confidence level: 95% #>  #>                          statistic    p-value   #> location_1 ~ location_2 0.03870907 0.99999236   #> location_1 ~ location_3 2.51608965 0.31194094   #> location_1 ~ location_4 4.82315032 0.01356971 * #> location_2 ~ location_3 2.55479873 0.29951264   #> location_2 ~ location_4 4.86185939 0.01277452 * #> location_3 ~ location_4 2.30706067 0.38453323  t$type <- "permu" t$print() #>  #>   Multiple Comparison Based on Studentized Statistic  #>  #> scoring: none    type: permu(5000)    method: tukey #>  #> family-wise confidence level: 95% #>  #>                          statistic p-value   #> location_1 ~ location_2 0.03870907  1.0000   #> location_1 ~ location_3 2.51608965  0.3016   #> location_1 ~ location_4 4.82315032  0.0148 * #> location_2 ~ location_3 2.55479873  0.2904   #> location_2 ~ location_4 4.86185939  0.0130 * #> location_3 ~ location_4 2.30706067  0.3736

title: Examples
code: # See ?JonckheereTerpstra or ?ksample.jt t <- pmt(     "ksample.jt", alternative = "greater", n_permu = 4000 )  # See ?Table3.4.1 t$test(Table3.4.1)  t$statistic #> [1] 145 t$p_value #> [1] 0.03125  t$type <- "asymp" t$p_value #> [1] 0.0285154

title: Examples
code: # See ?PairedDifference or ?paired.difference t <- pmt(     "paired.difference",     alternative = "greater", scoring = "none", n_permu = 0 )  # See ?Table4.1.1 t$test(Table4.1.1)  t$statistic #> [1] 960 t$p_value #> [1] 0.09375

title: Examples
code: # See ?PairedDifference or ?paired.difference t <- pmt(     "paired.difference", alternative = "two_sided",     scoring = "none", method = "without_zeros", n_permu = 0 )  # See ?Table4.1.3 t$test(Table4.1.3)  t$statistic #> [1] 148 t$p_value #> [1] 0.02502441  t$n_permu <- 4000 t$p_value #> [1] 0.0215  t$type <- "asymp" t$p_value #> [1] 0.0267714

title: Examples
code: # See ?PairedDifference or ?paired.difference t <- pmt(     "paired.difference", alternative = "greater",     scoring = "rank", method = "with_zeros", n_permu = 0 )  # See ?Table4.1.1 t$test(Table4.1.1)  t$statistic #> [1] 13 t$p_value #> [1] 0.09375  t$type <- "asymp" t$p_value #> [1] 0.08876493

title: Examples
code: # See ?Sign or ?paired.sign t <- pmt(     "paired.sign", alternative = "greater", type = "exact" )  t$test(     rep(c(+1, -1), c(12, 5)),     rep(0, 17) )  t$statistic #> [1] 12 t$p_value #> [1] 0.07173157  t$type <- "asymp" t$p_value #> [1] 0.07280505

title: Examples
code: # See ?RCBDOneWay or ?rcbd.oneway t <- pmt(     "rcbd.oneway", n_permu = 5000 )  # See ?Table4.4.3 t$test(Table4.4.3)  t$statistic #> [1] 110241.8 t$p_value #> [1] 0.0546  t$type <- "asymp" t$statistic #> [1] 3.121093 t$p_value #> [1] 0.057516

title: Examples
code: # See ?Friedman or ?rcbd.friedman t <- pmt(     "rcbd.friedman", n_permu = 5000 )  # See ?Table4.5.3 t$test(Table4.5.3)  t$statistic #> [1] 28.33333 t$p_value #> [1] 0.0396  t$type <- "asymp" t$statistic #> [1] 7.5 t$p_value #> [1] 0.05755845

title: Examples
code: # See ?Page or ?rcbd.page t <- pmt(     "rcbd.page", alternative = "less", n_permu = 5000 )  # See ?Table4.4.3 t$test(Table4.4.3)  t$statistic #> [1] 134 t$p_value #> [1] 0.0118  t$type <- "asymp" t$p_value #> [1] 0.01182581

title: Examples
code: # See ?Correlation or ?association.corr t <- pmt(     "association.corr", method = "pearson",     alternative = "greater", n_permu = 2000 )  # See ?Table5.1.2 t$test(Table5.1.2)  t$statistic #> [1] 198766597 t$p_value #> [1] 0

title: Examples
code: # See ?Correlation or ?association.corr t <- pmt(     "association.corr", method = "spearman",     alternative = "two_sided", n_permu = 5000 )  # See ?Table5.1.2 t$test(Table5.1.2)  t$statistic #> [1] 2059 t$p_value #> [1] 0  t$type <- "asymp" t$p_value #> [1] 0.0002176436

title: Examples
code: # See ?Correlation or ?association.corr t <- pmt(     "association.corr", method = "kendall",     alternative = "greater", type = "asymp" )  # See ?Table5.2.2 t$test(Table5.2.2)  t$statistic #> [1] 0.2222222 t$p_value #> [1] 0.1697136

title: Examples
code: # See ?ChiSquare or ?table.chisq t <- pmt(     "table.chisq", n_permu = 0 )  # See ?Table5.4.2 t$test(Table5.4.2)  t$statistic #> [1] 4.277778 t$p_value #> [1] 0.3142857  t$type <- "asymp" t$p_value #> [1] 0.1177856

title: Authors and Citation
text: Du Y (2024). LearnNonparam: Nonparametric Tests. R package version 1.2.2, https://qddyy.github.io/LearnNonparam, https://github.com/qddyy/LearnNonparam.
code: @Manual{,   title = {LearnNonparam: Nonparametric Tests},   author = {Yan Du},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 1.2.2, https://qddyy.github.io/LearnNonparam},   url = {https://github.com/qddyy/LearnNonparam}, }

title: Nonparametric Tests
text: R package implements several non-parametric tests chapters 1-5 Higgins (2003). depends R6 object oriented design Rcpp integration R C++. examples book can found .

title: Nonparametric Tests
text: latest bug fixes improvements, please install development version R package using Feedback contributions welcome. Please feel free report bugs request new features opening issue.
code: # install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("qddyy/LearnNonparam")

title: Nonparametric Tests
text: Construct test object R6 class directly using pmt (permutation test) wrapper Provide samples  Check results      Modify settings observe change  define_pmt allows users define new permutation tests. Take two-sample Cramér-Von Mises test example:
code: library(LearnNonparam) options(LearnNonparam.pmt_progress = TRUE) t <- Wilcoxon$new(n_permu = 1e6) # recommended for a unified API t <- pmt("twosample.wilcoxon", n_permu = 1e6) t$test(rnorm(10, 1), rnorm(10, 0)) t$statistic t$p_value options(digits = 2)  t$print() ggplot2::theme_set(ggplot2::theme_minimal())  t$plot(style = "ggplot2", binwidth = 1) t$type <- "asymp" t$p_value t <- define_pmt(     # this is a two-sample permutation test     inherit = "twosample",     statistic = function(x, y) {         # (optional) pre-calculate certain constants that remain invariant during permutation         n_x <- length(x)         n_y <- length(y)         F_x <- seq_len(n_x) / n_x         G_y <- seq_len(n_y) / n_y         # return a closure to calculate the test statistic         function(x, y) {             x <- sort.int(x)             y <- sort.int(y)             F <- approxfun(x, F_x, "constant", 0, 1, ties = "ordered")             G <- approxfun(y, G_y, "constant", 0, 1, ties = "ordered")             sum(c(F_x - G(x), G_y - F(y))^2)         }     },     # reject the null hypothesis when the test statistic is large     rejection = "r",     scoring = "none", n_permu = 1e4,     name = "Two-Sample Cramér-Von Mises Test",     alternative = "samples are from different continuous distributions" )  t$test(rnorm(10), runif(10))$print()

title: Ansari-Bradley Test — AnsariBradley
code: AnsariBradley$new(   type = c("permu", "asymp"),   alternative = c("two_sided", "less", "greater"),   n_permu = 10000 )

title: Ansari-Bradley Test — AnsariBradley
text: type character string specifying way calculate p-value. alternative character string specifying alternative hypothesis. n_permu integer indicating number permutations permutation distribution. set zero (default) permutations used.

what: Syntactic Sugar for Object Construction — pmt
title: Syntactic Sugar for Object Construction — pmt
Syntactic Sugar for Object Construction — pmt
code: pmt(key, ...)  pmts(   which = c("all", "onesample", "twosample", "ksample", "multcomp", "paired", "rcbd",     "association", "table") )  define_pmt(   statistic,   inherit = c("twosample", "ksample", "paired", "rcbd", "association", "table"),   rejection = c("lr", "l", "r"),   scoring = c("none", "rank", "vw", "expon"),   n_permu = 10000,   name = "User-Defined Permutation Test",   alternative = NULL,   depends = character(),   plugins = character(),   includes = character() )

title: Syntactic Sugar for Object Construction — pmt
text: key character string corresponding desired test. Check pmts() valid keys. ... extra parameters passed constructor. character string specifying desired tests. statistic definition test statistic. See Details. inherit character string specifying desired permutation test. rejection character string specifying rejection region . scoring, n_permu passed constructor. name character string specifying name test. alternative character string specifying alternative test. depends, plugins, includes passed Rcpp::cppFunction().

title: Syntactic Sugar for Object Construction — pmt
text: test statistic define_pmt can defined using either R Rcpp, statistic parameter specified : R: function returning closure returns double. Rcpp: character string defining captureless lambda (introduced C++11) returning another lambda may capture value, accepts const arguments type, returns double. using Rcpp, parameters different inherit listed follows. Note parameter names illustrative may modified. "twosample": (Rcpp::NumericVector sample_1, Rcpp::NumericVector sample_2) "ksample": (Rcpp::NumericVector combined_sample, Rcpp::IntegerVector one_based_group_index) "paired": (Rcpp::NumericVector sample_1, Rcpp::NumericVector sample_2) "rcbd": (Rcpp::NumericMatrix block_as_column_data) "association": (Rcpp::NumericVector sample_1, Rcpp::NumericVector sample_2) "table": (Rcpp::IntegerMatrix contingency_table) Defining test statistic using R follows similar approach. purpose design pre-calculate certain constants remain invariant permutation.

title: LearnNonparam 1.2.2
text: Changed default value n_permu 1e4 Added support test statistics defined using Rcpp define_pmt Added support null_value zero two-sample location tests Added support scoring TwoSampleAssociationTest Added LearnNonparam.pmt_progress option Added attr(t$n_permu, "n_used") Replaced multicomp.* multcomp.* Replaced KSampleF RCBDF OneWay RCBDOneWay Stopped exporting abstract classes (TwoSampleTest, KSampleTest, etc.) Improved efficiency ChiSquare, Difference, JonckheereTerpstra, KruskalWallis, RatioMeanDeviance Studentized Fixed many bugs Introduced new progress bar, built compile time minimize runtime overhead

title: LearnNonparam 1.2.1
text: Added define_pmt Added error messages Added active bindings Introduced graphics alternative ggplot2 Introduced compiler::cmpfun better performance Renamed ANOVA, RCBD, RCBDANOVA SignedDiff Replaced MultiCompT TukeyHSD Studentized Replaced "approx" "asymp" Improved MultipleComparison Improved CDF$plot() Fixed many bugs new progress bar Support larger n_permu

title: LearnNonparam 1.2.0
text: Added logo Introduced Rcpp Replaced Mean Difference Replaced SignedScore SignedDiff Replaced PermuTest$feed() PermuTest$test() Accelerated RCBD TwoSamplePairedTest Improved print() plot() method CDF, MultipleComparison PermuTest Added "approx" option Quantile$type Fixed many bugs
